skill.name: cookoff
skill.description: This skill should be used when moving from design to implementation. Triggers on "let's build", "implement this", "looks good let's code", "ready to implement". Presents options for parallel agent competition (cookoff), single subagent, or local implementation. Each agent creates own plan from shared design for genuine variation.
skill.summary: This skill should be used when moving from design to implementation. Triggers on "let's build", "imp...
skill.author: 2389-research

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based orchestrator skill containing only documentation and workflow guidance. No executable code, no network operations, no filesystem access, no environment variable access.

content.value_statement: Implementing features without competition can miss better solutions. Cookoff runs multiple agents in parallel, each creating their own plan from shared design. Tests and reviews pick the winner.
actual_capabilities: Detect design-to-implementation transition and present options
Assess feature complexity and recommend implementation count
Create git worktrees for parallel agent execution
Dispatch all agents in single message for true parallelism
Orchestrate fresh-eyes review and judge scoring
Cleanup loser branches and document results
limitations: Requires a completed design document to work effectively
Dependent on other skills for execution (writing-plans, executing-plans, fresh-eyes)
Not designed for trivial or emergency fixes where speed is critical
Higher compute cost due to parallel execution

use_cases.title: Evaluate architectural approaches
use_cases.description: When multiple valid architectures exist, run parallel implementations to let tests decide the winner.

use_cases.title: Quality gate implementations
use_cases.description: Before accepting major contributions, run cookoff to validate approach and discover edge cases.

use_cases.title: Challenge assumptions
use_cases.description: Second-guess your first implementation approach by running an alternative in parallel.

prompt_templates.title: Start cookoff
prompt_templates.prompt: We have a design doc ready. Let's run a cookoff.

prompt_templates.title: Cookoff specific feature
prompt_templates.prompt: Cookoff this feature: build an API rate limiter with Redis backend.

prompt_templates.title: Run with existing design
prompt_templates.prompt: Our design doc is complete at docs/plans/auth-system/design.md. How should we cookoff?

prompt_templates.title: Parallel with complexity
prompt_templates.prompt: Run cookoff on our new payments integration. Design is in docs/plans/payments/design.md. Complexity is high.

output_examples.input: Run cookoff on the auth system design at docs/plans/auth-system/design.md
output: Complexity assessment: medium feature, touches auth
Each will create their own implementation plan from the design
Fresh-eyes review complete: impl-2 has 0 issues

best_practices: Ensure design document is complete and approved before running cookoff
Let each agent create their own implementation plan for genuine variation
Always run fresh-eyes review before invoking judge scoring
anti_patterns: Sharing a pre-made implementation plan with all agents (creates duplicates)
Dispatching agents in separate messages (defeats parallelism)
Skipping fresh-eyes review before judging implementations

faq.question: How many implementations should I run?
faq.answer: Complexity assessment determines count. Low: 2, Medium: 3, High: 4, Very high: 5.

faq.question: What happens to the losing implementations?
faq.answer: Loser worktrees and branches are cleaned up. Winner is prepared for merge or PR creation.

faq.question: Can cookoff run without other skills installed?
faq.answer: Cookoff orchestrates dependencies. Fallbacks exist but full functionality requires referenced skills.

faq.question: Is my data safe during parallel execution?
faq.answer: Each implementation runs in isolated git worktrees. No cross-contamination between implementations.

faq.question: What if all implementations are too similar?
faq.answer: Diff check before fresh-eyes flags >95% similarity. This indicates planning step needs more variation.

faq.question: How is cookoff different from just running multiple agents?
faq.answer: Cookoff enforces shared design but independent planning. Each agent creates their own plan from the design doc.
